page.title: 01Villages near Winchester
page.content: {King's Worthy and Springvale}are two {villages}that have become merged into one by the building of housing estates amongst them. The area contains some interesting features including a Norman church, a Saxon church which is in the same living but situated just on the border of this area, an old public house, once a coaching inn, many old houses, a disused railway line, a modern motorway and most of the facilities required for life today. On the edge of the area lie the {villages}of{Easton and Martyr Worthy along the banks of the Itchen. These are residential and are linked to the rest by farmland.
